intro: Aeranthes carnosa, commonly known as the pink orchid, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), helping it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Aeranthes carnosa is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in greenhouses or warm climates.
